page.title: 01UTTOXETER - AN INTRODUCTION
page.content: Uttoxeter is a small market town lying close to the Staffs-Derbyshire border,14 miles NE of Stafford. The town has a population of 10,008 and is mainly associated with its race course and the penitence of Dr Samuel Johnson who,in the late 18th century, stood bareheaded in the rain in atonement for his youthful refusal to man his father's Market Place bookstall. The town is possessed of good road links with its neighbours,the most recently completed being the new Stoke link road which by-passes many of the intermediate villagers,relievingthe problems of motorists and villagers alike. Although Uttoxeter station is no longer manned,we still enjoy good rail links to Stoke and Derby.
